thread.title: North East EU Referendum results and turnout - how the region voted in full

author: Michael Marsh
title: North East EU Referendum results and turnout - how the region voted in full
text:
Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Thousands of voters went to the polls to have their say on the UK’s future in the European Union .
On the night of the historic referendum on June 23 2016, the North East’s local authorities held counts and results were then declared centrally in Sunderland.
The votes from the 382 council counts were then collated at 12 regional centres across the country.
And, as we now know, the people made their voices heard as the UK voted to leave - then Brexit was born.
The following morning resulted in the resignation of Prime Minister David Cameron - a staunch remain supporter.
Here is a look back at how the North East voted in full. Read More
